content: The file defining finitely generated modules is RingTheory/Finiteness.lean. Is there any particular reason why this definition is located in RingTheory and not in Algebra/Moduleor in LinearAlgebra? The reason I’m asking is that I’d like to add a definition for finitely presented modules that should at least make use of the Module.Finitedefinition and I think this would make more sense to put it in Algebra/Modules rather than in RingTheory, but I’m not sure if it’s a good idea for future maintenance to have these related definition so far from each other.
You should feel free to add it already, we can always move things later
BTW there are some abandoned code here about finitely presented modules (in lean3), which would hopefully be helpful.
Robin Carlier has marked this topic as resolved.
